I am an undergradate researcher at the BI Lab @ Seoul Nat'l University advised by Byoung-Tak Zhang. I am also the Senior Undergradate student at Sogang University, majoring Computer Science. I had previously worked as a Machine Learning Engineer Intern at Nota Inc., and developed YOLO based detection models at ITS Team. I had co-founded and worked as a Senior Designer at OCONNECT Student Venture, based on UNIST.

My research field encompasses computer vision and deep learning systems, spanning the intersection of computer science and mathematics. Iâ€™m interested in data science which can solve problems in reality logically, particularly focusing on data analytics and statistical method. Recently, I have an interest on semantic segmentation and domain adaptation field and aggressively participating in various contests.

I strive to achieve the goal of enhancing human lifestyles through my own reasoning. I enjoy extracting insights from diverse datasets, utilizing cutting-edge models to solve real-world problems. With a passion for Deep learning & Data, I have a strong foundation in engineering and scientific disciplines. Continuously improving my skills, I'm particularly interested in applying language models and state-of-the-art techniques to contribute to collaborative problem-solving.
